dc:description: *MYOM1* was first reported in relation to hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) in humans in 2011 (Siegert et al, 2011, PMID 21256114). *MYOM1* has been associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) in 11 probands across 4 publications (Siegert et al, 2011, PMID 21256114; Cecconi M, et al., 2016, PMID: 27600940; Bottillo I, et al., 2016, PMID: 26656175; Guo X, et al., 2017, PMID: 28323875). A single missense variant, p.Val1490Ile, segregated in 2 affected family members with HCM and destabilized dimerization of the MYOM1 protein; however, variants in all 8 sarcomeric genes were not ruled out (Siegert et al, 2011, PMID 21256114). Nine additional missense variants, one intronic variant, one splice-site variant, and a synonymous variant are included in this curation. All but one received reduced scores either due to the presence of variants in other HCM genes, inconsistent phenotypes, or high allele frequencies in gnomAD (Cecconi M, et al., 2016, PMID: 27600940; Bottillo I, et al., 2016, PMID: 26656175; Guo X, et al., 2017, PMID: 28323875). The mechanism for disease is unknown.This gene-disease relationship is supported by an expression study (Schoenauer et al, 2011, PMID 21069531). This gene-disease pair was originally evaluated by the ClinGen Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Gene Curation Expert Panel on July 20th, 2017. It was reevaluated by the Hereditary Cardiovascular Disease Gene Curation Expert Panel on February 23rd, 2023. As a result of this reevaluation, the classification was changed from limited to disputed.
curationReasonDescription: Given the reduction in score upon recuration and the lack of new evidence, this gene-disease association has been moved from limited to disputed.

evidence.dc:description: Expressed in healthy human heart, detected by qRT-PCR and immunofluorescence.  However, Myom1 has been shown to be expressed in mouse skeletal muscle, so its expression is not limited to cardiomyocytes.
evidence.rdfs:label: MYOM1 expression

evidence.dc:description: This proband has a missense variant, p.R711C, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 8/30592 South Asian alleles at a frequency of 0.0002615, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. Pt also has two variants in RAF1 (c.[124G>A;125C>T]p.A42I;Ala42Val) which are both likely benign in ClinVar and RAF1 is no gene-disease record at present for RAF1 and HCM. This proband is scored default points.

This proband has a missense variant, Arg696His. MAF=0.001792 in East Asian (35/19530 alleles), total allele frequency=0.0002032. No homozygotes. v2.1.1. Frequency is too high, variant is likely benign in ClinVar, and proband has variants in other HCM genes including MYBPC3, MYH7, and TNNT2.

gnomAD max MAF: European (Non-Finnish) 5/78850, 0 hm, MAF: 0.00006341. This pt did not have variants in MYH7 or MYBPC3, but it is not stated whether other HCM genes were sequenced so they received a reduced score.

His-tagged recombinant proteins of myomesin domains 11–13 (42 kDa) and 12–13 (25 kDa) of the wild type and the V1490I mutated myomesin underwent protein–protein-binding studies by SPR and CD based thermal stability analysis. These tests showed that p.Val1490Ile significantly decreases affinity and destabilizes the dimerization of MYOM1 proteins compared to wild type controls.

This proband has a splice site variant, c.432-1G>T. MAF=0.00001597 in European (non-Finnish) (2/125212 alleles), total allele frequency=0.000007246. No homozygotes. gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband is given reduced points due to a diagnosis of borderline HCM.

This proband also has a synonymous variant, K886K, that is likely benign in ClinVar and is present in 2/15476 African/African American alleles at a frequency of 0.0001292, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. Additionally, this proband has variants in DSP (p.K1481_1481del), SCN5A (p.S1946F), DSC2 (p.I776M), LAMA4 (p.M1161T), LAMP2 (p.L140V), MYH7 (p.D1378D), and GATAD1 (p.G152G) which are either not present in or of uncertain significance in ClinVar. This proband is scored reduced points.

This proband has an intronic missense variant that is not present in gnomAD. Pt also has variants in TNNT2 (p.R84S), RBM20 (p.D20G), CAV3 (p.T78M), and MYPN (p.A135A) which are either not present or have conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity in ClinVar. This proband is scored reduced points.

This proband has a missense variant, G836V, of uncertain significance in Clinvar that is present in 9/17842 East Asian alleles at a frequency of 0.0005044, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. This proband also has variants in MYH7 (R719E-pathogenic in ClinVar) and AKAP9 (C3864R-not present in ClinVar. This proband is scored reduced points.

This proband has a missense variant, p.S67A, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. The variant is reported in 6/110412 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.00005434, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1. Pt also has variants in ABCC9 (c.2867-5T>C (likely benign)), PKP2 (p.D26N (benign/likely benign)), TNNT2 (p.K252I (conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity)), SCN5A (p.D872N (uncertain significance)), BAG3 (p.A155T (conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity​)), and DSG2 (p.A780A(likely benign)). This proband is scored reduced points.

This proband has a missense variant, Glu505Ala. MAF=0.00002360 in East Asian (3/127134 alleles), total allele frequency=0.00001081. No homozygotes. v2.1.1. Variant is of uncertain significance in ClinVar and proband has variants in other HCM genes including LAMP2 and TNNT2.

This proband has a missense variant, Ser47Gly. MAF=0.03772 in European (Finnish) (935/24786 alleles), total allele frequency=0.007187. Homozygotes are present in gnomAD v2.1.1. Variant is benign in ClinVar, frequency is too high, and proband has variants in other HCM genes including MYBPC3 and MYH6.

This proband has a missense variant, Glu704Lys. MAF=0.03362 in European (Finnish) (841/25016 alleles), total allele frequency=0.006933. Homozygotes are present in gnomAD. v2.1.1. Variant is benign in ClinVar, frequency is too high, and proband has variants in other HCM genes including MYBPC3 and MYH6.
This proband has a missense variant, Gly552Asp. Not present in gnomAD. Proband has a variant in another HCM gene-MYH7.

This proband has a missense variant, p.R711H, that is of uncertain significance in ClinVar. This residue is conserved across evolutionarily distant species. The variant is reported in 18/128362 European (non-Finnish) alleles at a frequency of 0.0001402, with no homozygotes in gnomAD v2.1.1.  Additionally, this proband has variants in DSP (p.K1481_1481del), SCN5A (p.S1946F), DSC2 (p.I776M), LAMA4 (p.M1161T), LAMP2 (p.L140V), MYH7 (p.D1378D), and GATAD1 (p.G152G) which are either not present in or of uncertain significance in ClinVar. This proband is scored reduced points.
Predicted deleterious in 11/12 in silico models.
